_note: This is an example of what MOS-Researcher produces. Generated by Marketing OS in ~5 minutes.
subject: Marketing Directors at B2B SaaS companies, $5M-$30M ARR, evaluating analytics tools

demographics.other_filters: Companies with 3+ marketing team members, currently using Google Analytics or basic BI tools

psychographics.primary_pain: Can't connect marketing spend to revenue. CFO asks 'what did we get for that $200K?' and they don't have a clear answer.
psychographics.secondary_pain: Drowning in dashboards but starving for insights. 7 tools, 12 reports, zero clarity on what's actually working.
psychographics.aspirations: Walk into leadership meetings with a clear revenue attribution story. Be the person who knows which channels drive pipeline, not the person guessing.
frustrations: GA4 migration broke all their historical comparisons
Attribution models give different answers depending on which tool they check
Engineering team won't prioritize tracking instrumentation
Every vendor claims 'full-funnel visibility' but none deliver it
psychographics.how_they_measure_success: Pipeline generated from marketing, cost per opportunity, marketing-influenced revenue, board-ready reporting speed

actual_phrases: I spend more time building reports than reading them
My CEO thinks marketing is a cost center because I can't prove otherwise
We tried 3 attribution tools and they all showed different numbers
I just want to know: which campaign generated the deals that closed?
GA4 is a nightmare. We lost 2 years of historical data in the migration.
sources: Reddit r/marketing — 15 threads on attribution pain (2025-2026)
G2 reviews of Mixpanel, Amplitude, HubSpot — 40 reviews analyzed
YouTube comments on attribution tutorial videos — 12 comment threads

trusted_formats: case studies with specific revenue numbers
what_they_skip: gated white papers requiring phone number
content_behavior.decision_triggers: Board meeting pressure, new fiscal year budget planning, competitor launching with better data, or losing a key team member who was 'the analytics person'

competitor_weaknesses: GA4: Confusing UI, lost historical data, no revenue attribution
HubSpot: Only works within HubSpot ecosystem, expensive for full suite
Looker: Requires engineer to maintain, not marketer-friendly
competitive_landscape.our_positioning_gap: Marketer-friendly revenue attribution that works across all channels without requiring engineering support
competitive_landscape.switching_barriers: Historical data in existing tools, team trained on current workflows, integration with existing tech stack

sources_consulted: Web search — 18 sources on B2B marketing analytics landscape
G2 reviews — 40 reviews across 5 analytics platforms
YouTube — 8 videos on attribution, comments analyzed
Competitor websites — 6 analytics tool sites reviewed
research_methodology.research_gaps: Need customer interview data for pricing sensitivity. Review data skews toward enterprise — mid-market voice underrepresented.

confidence_reasoning: 87 data points across 5 source types. Voice-of-customer quotes pulled directly from user reviews and forum posts. Competitive analysis verified against actual product pages.
recommended_next_steps: Create comparison content: '[Product] vs GA4' and '[Product] vs HubSpot Reporting'
Target the 'board meeting pressure' trigger with case study showing CEO-ready dashboard
Use the phrase 'marketing is not a cost center' as campaign anchor — it resonates strongly
